knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

```{r install-libraries}
library(lubridate)
library(tidyverse)
library(data.table)
```

## Step 1 Read in the data
First download and then read in with data.table:fread()
```{r read-data, cache=TRUE}
if (!file.exists("met_all.gz")) {
download.file("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/USCbiostats/data-science-data/master/02_met/met_all.gz", "met_all.gz", method="libcurl", timeout = 60) 
}
met <- data.table::fread("met_all.gz") 
```

##Step 2 Prepare the Data 

Remove temperatures less than -17C and Make sure there are no missing data in the key variables coded as 9999, 999, etc
```{r remove-low-temp}
met <- met[temp> -17] [elev == 9999.0, elev := NA]
```

# check no 9999s in other important variables 

Generate a date variable using the functions as.Date() (hint: You will need the following to create a date paste(year, month, day, sep = "-")).
```{r create-ymd, cache=TRUE}
met <- met[ , ymd:= as.Date(paste(year, month, day, sep = "-"))]
```


Using the data.table::week function, keep the observations of the first week of the month.
```{r}
met[, table(week(ymd))]
met <- met[week(ymd)==31]
```

Compute the mean by station of the variables temp, rh, wind.sp, vis.dist, dew.point, lat, lon, and elev.

```{r}
met [, .(
  temp = max(temp,na.rm=T),
  rh = max(rh,na.rm=T),
  wind.sp = max(wind.sp,na.rm=T),
  vis.dist = max(vis.dist,na.rm=T),
  dew.point = max(dew.point,na.rm=T),
  lat = max(lat,na.rm=T),
  lon = max(lon,na.rm=T),
  elev = max(elev,na.rm=T)
)]
```
Great! No more 9999s in our dataset.

```{r check-avg}
met [, .(
  temp = mean(temp,na.rm=T),
  rh = mean(rh,na.rm=T),
  wind.sp = mean(wind.sp,na.rm=T),
  vis.dist = mean(vis.dist,na.rm=T),
  dew.point = mean(dew.point,na.rm=T),
  lat = mean(lat,na.rm=T),
  lon = mean(lon,na.rm=T),
  elev = mean(elev,na.rm=T)
), by = 'USAFID'] 
```
